summary: This article discusses the evolving concept of 'ecosystem architecture,' which transcends traditional biological boundaries to address modern, distributed, and asynchronous human organizations. Rooted in decentralization and regenerative design, this new practice seeks to innovate through a blend of diverse disciplines, aiming for healthier and more vibrant systems.
excerpt: Ecosystem architecture, blending decentralization and regenerative design, aims to innovate through diverse disciplines, making systems healthier and more vibrant.
